org.rexcrawler

Class Crawler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<java.lang.Void>
      • java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
        • org.rexcrawler.Crawler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>

    public class Crawler
extends java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
    Crawler This object act as a Runnable implementation for the Java forkjoin framework. Among the many (not implemented) features includes multithreading which involve synchronization and shared objects (@Reduced).
    This program contains material that may be disturbing to some viewers.
    Viewer discretion is advised.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(java.net.URL... targets)
        Start crawling the targets using all available resources. Usually all the cores available for the JVM.
        Parameters:
        targets - list of the URL to parse

      • run

        public void run(int parallel,
       java.net.URL... targets)
        Start crawling the targets using parallel threads. The optimal solution will be to set parallel to the number of cores available. However this method allows to scale down the resources reserved for the parsing.
        Parameters:
        parallel - number of thread to use
        targets - list of the URL to parse

      • compute

        protected void compute()
        Specified by:
        compute in class java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction

      • getFollowedLinkCount

        public int getFollowedLinkCount()
        Get the total number of link followed in the last search. This number is reset at each new run().
        Returns:
        number of links followed

      • getChunkSize

        public int getChunkSize()
        Get the maximum number of links assigned to a single thread.
        Returns:
        maximum links per thread

      • getSearchLength

        public java.lang.Integer getSearchLength()
        Get the upperbound limit of the crawler. The search stops if the total number of followed links is equal to this.
        Returns:
        limit followed links.

      • getHandler

        public CrawlerHandler getHandler()
        Get the current handler used by this crawler.
        Returns:
        handler in use

      • setChunkSize

        public Crawler setChunkSize(int chunkSize)
        Set the number of URL per thread. By default this is set to NO_FORK which allows the sequential parsing of each URL. Setting the chunkSize > 0 will enable multithreading. For chunkSize > 0, each thread exceeding chunkSize will fork, delegate the surplus to its child, and execute.
        Parameters:
        chunkSize - minimum number of links to fork
        Returns:
        the calling object

      • setSearchLength

        public Crawler setSearchLength(int searchLength)
        Set the maximum number of links to follow before giving up. If the total number of links followed reach this limit, the search will terminate. By default only the submitted URL will be parsed.
        Parameters:
        searchLength - maximum number of followed links
        Returns:
        the calling object

      • setHandler

        public Crawler setHandler(CrawlerHandler handler)
        Set the handle for the parsing
        Parameters:
        handler -
        Returns:
        the calling object
